result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather K Murphy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Heather K Murphy in court, in custody with attorney Mark David Lawton. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No corrections to the PSI. Sentencing statements made. Court sentenced defendant to 6 years prison, consecutive to all other sentences, consisting of 1 year confinement & 5 years extended supervision. Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Academy, is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  No jail credit.

9:33 A.M., Defendant Heather K Murphy in court with attorney Mark David Lawton.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Atty Lawton withdraws NGI plea previously given, Court accepts, Court withholds sentence, probation 4 years, $3,366.58 Restitution plus surcharge, Defendant to submit DNA Sample, $518.00 costs, if three years of probation are successfully completed, no new law violations and restitution paid in full, and if DOC approved, probation may be discharged early, 9:48 A.M.
